d: King escapes pursuers through hollow tree in his hall.
Stolen child found in hollow tree.
Forest as refuge of eloping lovers.
Negro takes refuge under princess's throne.

r: Irish myth: *Cross; Jewish: *Neuman; India: Thompson-Balys; Eskimo, (Greenland): Rasmussen I 150.

d: Christians crushed in cave where they take refuge from heathen.

r: Fb "kilde" II 118b; Irish myth: Cross; Africa (Benga): Nassau 225 No. 33, (Kaffir): Theal 129, (Basuto): Jacottet 160 No. 23.

d: Girl hidden in skin of her dead mother.
Boy hidden under skin in order not to be seen and prophesied about.

r: (Cf. +R324.) Greek: Fox 250; Hindu: Keith 76; Japanese: Ikeda; Korean: Zong in-Sob 218 No. 98; Eskimo (West Hudson Bay): Boas BAM XV 360; N. A. Indian: Thompson Tales 291f.
a: Fugitives rise in the air and become stars.

d: Sister escapes to the stars to avoid marrying brother.
a: He is the thunder and her face is Lightning.
Pursued hero escapes to moon.

r: Scottish: Campbell-McKay 1 n., 25; N. A. Indian (California): Gayton and Newman 95.

d: Murderer escapes to sky on sky rope.
Murderer escapes to sky in magic chariot.

a: Fugitive supernaturally rises in air to escape.

d: Escape from battle by flying in air.

d: Devil chases ghost of wicked man until he puts his head into chapel window.
Idol cracks open to grant refuge to fugitive in answer to prayer; then closes again.
Hero takes refuge at king's court.
Roof as refuge for pursued animals.
r: West Indies: *Flowers 573  75, Parsons MAFLS XVIII (3) 26 No. 6.

d: Lightning strikes branch on which man is being hanged.
a: Delay gives him chance to prove his innocence.

d: Fugitive discovered by reflection in water.

d: Milk drops from woman's breast on tiger's leg and reveals her hiding place in tree.

d: Lovers fleeing from slavery are recaptured.
